episodeTitle: Find a Way Out! Rocketman Takes Flight!
episodeTitleJapanese: 活路を開け！空を飛ぶロケットマン！
episodeTitleRomanized: Katsuro wo ake! Sora wo tobu rokettoman!
description: The Straw Hats and their allies aboard the Rocketman sea train race toward Enies Lobby to rescue Robin. Yokozuna helps launch the train over the gates using them as a ramp. The flying train crashes into Oimo, knocking him unconscious. Meanwhile, Robin and Franky are brought before Spandam and CP9.

events.title: Baskerville's First Appearance
events.description: Baskerville, the Chief Justice of Enies Lobby, makes his debut. He is actually three men (Bas, And, and Kerville) working together in a costume to appear as one individual. He coordinates the defense of Enies Lobby against the Straw Hat invasion.
events.significance: Introduction of Enies Lobby's de facto commander and the unique three-person character concept.

events.title: Watchdog Unit of the Law Debut
events.description: The Watchdog Unit of the Law, Enies Lobby's first class guards, are introduced. These lean, muscular soldiers ride large dogs and wield arm blades. Baskerville sends one hundred members to defend against the invaders.
events.significance: Introduction of Enies Lobby's elite guard unit and escalation of the conflict.

events.title: Luffy Uses Gomu Gomu no Kazan
events.description: Luffy demonstrates the Gomu Gomu no Kazan (Gum-Gum Volcano) technique while fighting Marines. This attack involves stretching his foot upward to break through ceilings or strike enemies from below.
events.significance: Showcases Luffy's continued development and creative application of his Devil Fruit powers.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy attacking Marines with an upward stretching kick

events.title: Robin and Franky Brought Before Spandam
events.description: Nico Robin and Franky are presented to Spandam, the leader of CP9, at Enies Lobby. This marks a critical moment in the rescue mission as Robin is now directly in the hands of the World Government.
events.significance: Escalates the urgency of the rescue mission and sets up the confrontation with CP9 leadership.

events.title: Franky Attacks Spandam
events.description: Upon being brought before Spandam, Franky directly attacks him, demonstrating his defiance and unwillingness to cooperate with the World Government.
events.significance: Shows Franky's character and establishes his antagonistic relationship with Spandam.

events.title: Zoro Orders to Keep Going
events.description: When faced with the gates of Enies Lobby, Zoro makes the decision to simply keep going forward rather than finding a conventional way past. This leads to Yokozuna's creative solution.
events.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's straightforward leadership style and sets up the dramatic Rocketman flight.

events.title: Yokozuna Bends the Gates as a Ramp
events.description: Yokozuna, the giant sumo-wrestling frog, uses his incredible strength to bend the outer fence of Enies Lobby inward, creating a ramp. This allows the Rocketman train to launch into the air.
events.significance: A creative and spectacular solution that showcases Yokozuna's strength and the team's resourcefulness. This moment epitomizes the arc's momentum and determination.

events.title: The Rocketman Takes Flight
events.description: Using the bent gate as a ramp, the Rocketman sea train soars through the air, flying over the first and second gates of Enies Lobby. This spectacular moment has the entire rescue party airborne as they crash through the defenses.
events.significance: The iconic image of a flying sea train represents the unstoppable determination of the Straw Hats and their allies. One of the most memorable visual moments of the arc.

events.title: Oimo Knocked Unconscious by Rocketman
events.description: The flying Rocketman train crashes into Oimo's back, knocking the giant unconscious. Oimo, one of the two giant guards of Enies Lobby, is defeated not through direct combat but by the impact of the airborne sea train.
events.significance: Removes one of Enies Lobby's major defensive obstacles in a dramatic and unexpected fashion. Shows the overwhelming momentum of the rescue party.

events.title: Paulie Injured by Watchdog Unit
events.description: Paulie advances past the gate with the others but is stabbed in the shoulder by a member of the Watchdog Unit. Despite the injury, the Galley-La foremen continue to fight.
events.significance: Demonstrates the danger posed by the Watchdog Unit and the sacrifices being made by the rescue party.

events.title: Paulie's Top Knot Rope Technique
events.description: Paulie demonstrates his rope-based fighting techniques during the assault on Enies Lobby, using his signature Top Knot style to bind and attack enemies.
events.significance: Showcases Paulie's unique fighting style and his contribution to the rescue mission.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Using the Volcano technique against Marines

themes.description: The episode showcases the overwhelming momentum and determination of the Straw Hats and their allies. The image of the flying Rocketman train symbolizes their refusal to let any obstacle stop them from rescuing Robin.
themes.symbolism: The Rocketman flying through the air represents breaking through impossible barriers through sheer willpower and creative thinking.

themes.description: The entire rescue party - Straw Hats, Franky Family, Galley-La foremen, and even Yokozuna - work together to reach Robin, demonstrating the bonds formed throughout the Water 7 saga.
themes.symbolism: Yokozuna bending the gates represents the strength gained through unity and cooperation.

characterSpotlights.development: Yokozuna demonstrates his loyalty and incredible strength by creating the ramp that allows the rescue party to breach Enies Lobby's defenses.
keyActions: Bends the outer gates of Enies Lobby to create a ramp
Enables the Rocketman to fly over the defenses

characterSpotlights.development: First appearance of the three-in-one Chief Justice who coordinates Enies Lobby's defense.
keyActions: Coordinates defensive efforts against the invasion

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being captured and brought before Spandam, Franky maintains his defiant attitude and directly attacks the CP9 leader.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some of the action sequences with the Rocketman and added more details to the flight sequence.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the debut of Baskerville, who is actually three separate characters (Bas, And, and Kerville) working together in costume.
The Watchdog Unit of the Law are introduced as Enies Lobby's elite guards, riding on large dogs and wielding arm blades.

sources.title: Watchdog Unit of the Law - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode contains references to Mr. 3 twice: the Den Den Mushi resembles his communication device, and Luffy shouts 'Tonkachi' referencing a technique he used against Mr. 3.
Gomu Gomu no Kazan (Volcano) is similar to Gomu Gomu no Ono but with the foot stretched upward instead of downward, specifically designed for breaking through ceilings.
The name 'Baskerville' likely references both the three-headed dog Cerberus from Greek mythology and 'The Hound of the Baskervilles' novel.
'Brand New World' by D-51 is one of the shortest-running One Piece openings, spanning only 15 episodes (264-278).
